description: From Ancient Greek θίξις (thíxis, “touching”) +‎ Ancient Greek τροπή (tropḗ, “turning”, from τρέπω (trépō, “turn, change”)) +‎ -y.

entries.meaning: (physics) The reduction of viscosity with increased shear
(medicine) The property of certain gels whereby they become fluids when agitated and return to being solid or semi-solid when allowed to stand.
